line_1: How, Sacred Art, shall thy fame disperse!
line_2: How shall I sing the dignity of Verse!

line_1: So the wrong'd Sisters shall their griefs disperse,
line_2: And th' Age reform by my Satyrick Verse:

line_1: As Grots from whence the Winds disperse,
line_2: And if that future Times shall read my Verse.

line_1: As Grots from whence the Winds disperse,
line_2: Tho' worthless in it self, let them his Praise rehearse.
Hence slanderous Prose, and ribald Verse;

line_1: Your Arts of War will not this Cloud disperse;
line_2: Disdain not, Sir, the Instructions of our Verse,
The mist of error, whence our fears

line_1: Now sudden blasts the sounds disperse,
line_2: Some power unseen denies my verse
